result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Vannessa Marie Heredia was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 5:00 pm on 10/31/2022. Court grants 2 days credit
Fine to be paid at the rate of $100 per month commencing 12/01/2022 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with Fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on 11/09/2022.  Defendant to serve 20 days Huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vannessa Marie Heredia

defendant.name: Heredia, Vannessa Marie
defendant.address: N80w15821 Rainbow Dr, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:51 AM Defendant Vannessa Marie Heredia in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Vannessa Marie Heredia. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states that they are ready to proceed with plea/sentencing this morning. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy with the defendant and finds them guilty of count #1. Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law. Counts #3-4 are dismissed and read-in. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:
15 days in the Waukesha county jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 5 pm. on 10/31/2022.
2 days credit.

FINE W/IID SURCHARGE: $ 1229.00
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month, starting 12/01/2022  and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  Days in the Waukesha county jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Consecutive.

D/L REVOCATION: 14 months;
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 14 months;

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on: 11/09/22.
Defendant to serve 20 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Appeal rights given.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

2:11 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Vannessa Marie Heredia in court, in custody. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Erik Schlueter.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
